content: Yes, there are several workshops and resources available to help students with the National Science Foundation (NSF) Graduate Research Fellowship Program (GRFP) application process. At the University of Michigan, the Rackham Graduate School offers workshops and information sessions that provide guidance for students on how to prepare competitive GRFP proposals. They also offer individual meetings with experts in the field to assist students in developing strong and coherent research statements. The University of Michigan's Office of National Scholarship and Fellowships (ONSF) is another excellent resource for students seeking guidance on the GRFP application process. They offer one-on-one advising, group workshops, and informational events that can help students learn about the application process, understand the evaluation criteria, and develop effective strategies for crafting compelling research proposals. Additionally, the National Science Foundation provides a wealth of resources, including sample proposals, FAQs, and webinars on topics such as how to develop a great research proposal, how to choose a reference letter writer, and how to write a competitive personal statement. Overall, there are many resources and workshops available to help students navigate the application process for the GRFP. I would suggest that you check out the Rackham Graduate School and ONSF to learn more about the available resources and how to take advantage of them.
